question:
Consider the following sections of Indian society during the late British Era:
1. Depressed Classes
2. Muslims
3. Anglo-Indians
4. Indo-Christians
5. Europeans
Who among the above demanded separate electorates at the Round Table conference of early 1930s?
explanation: The First Round Table Conference was organized in the year 1930 in London. Depressed Classes, Muslims, Anglo-Indians, Indo-Christians, Europeans all of them demanded separate electorates. The session was dismissed beacuse of excessive demands of Muslim league and other depressed sections.
